home_intro.description: Welcome to KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE – KIMS Advanced Gastreroenterology & Endoscopy Clinic For Hyderabad’s Leading Center for Advanced Gastroenterology and Digestive Care.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we bring together innovation, expertise, and compassion to address complex gastrointestinal and liver disorders. With specialized clinics and cutting-edge facilities, we are dedicated to redefining healthcare standards in Medical and Surgical Gastroenterology, Advanced Endoscopy, and Hepatology.

With a state-of-the-art Endoscopy Unit and a dedicated team of specialists, KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE ensures precise diagnostics, minimally invasive therapies, and superior outcomes. Choose KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE for advanced care in Gastrointestinal Diseases, Liver Disorders, and beyond.

introduction.heading: KIMS
description: We are one of India's largest corporate healthcare groups, with a strong presence in Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Kerala. Our network of hospitals under the 'KIMS Hospitals' brand provides integrated, multi-disciplinary healthcare services, focusing on tertiary and quaternary care at affordable prices. With 15 multi-specialty hospitals and a combined capacity of over 4,900 beds, we offer a comprehensive range of services across more than 25 specialties and super specialties, including cardiac sciences, oncology, neurosciences, gastroenterology, orthopedics, organ transplantation, renal sciences, and mother & child care.

Our journey began with a single hospital, and under the visionary leadership of Dr. Bhaskar Rao Bollineni, Founder and Chairman, and Dr. Abhinay Bollineni, Executive Director and CEO, we have grown into a chain of multi-specialty hospitals. The first hospital in our network was established in Nellore in 2000, with around 200 beds. Our flagship hospital in Secunderabad, with a 1,000-bed capacity, is one of the largest private hospitals in India (excluding medical colleges), as noted by the CRISIL Report. Recent acquisitions have expanded our network to cities like Ongole, Vizag, Anantapur, Kurnool, Nagpur, Nashik, and Kannur between fiscal years 2017 and 2025.

We focus on the southern & western Indian healthcare market, where we understand regional cultures and healthcare needs, providing high-quality care at affordable rates. Each of our hospitals integrates diagnostic services and pharmacies to offer comprehensive care to our patients.

Dr. Bhaskar Rao Bollineni, a distinguished cardiothoracic surgeon with over 27 years of experience, established the KIMS Hospitals brand with the vision of creating a world-class healthcare system. Under his leadership and that of Dr. Abhinay Bollineni, who joined in 2014 and became CEO in 2019, we have strategically expanded across Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, and Kerala through greenfield projects, acquisitions, and organic growth.
Our success is driven by our commitment to affordable, high-quality healthcare and our strong relationships with medical professionals, which have been key to building the KIMS Hospitals brand.

advancedprocedures.title: POEM (Peroral Endoscopic Myotomy)
advancedprocedures.subtitle: Revolutionizing Treatment for Achalasia with Precision and Care

sections.heading: What is POEM?
content: POEM (Peroral Endoscopic Myotomy) is a cutting-edge, minimally invasive procedure designed to treat Achalasia—a condition that affects the esophagus, making it difficult for food and liquids to pass into the stomach. Unlike traditional surgeries, POEM utilizes advanced endoscopic technology to offer a solution that is not only effective but also comes with a faster recovery time and reduced discomfort.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we bring this innovative technique directly to our patients. We believe in harnessing the power of precision medicine to ensure that each patient experiences a smoother journey from diagnosis to recovery.

steps.title: Accessing the Esophagus
steps.description: The procedure begins with a small incision in the inner lining of your esophagus, which is done using a flexible endoscope. This allows the surgeon to navigate without the need for large incisions or traditional surgery.

steps.title: Disrupting the Muscle
steps.description: The next step involves cutting the muscle fibers in the lower esophagus (the myotomy) to relieve the pressure that prevents food from moving into the stomach. This part of the procedure is performed with a high level of precision, targeting only the muscle layers that need to be addressed.

steps.title: Sealing the Incision
steps.description: After the muscle is divided, the small incision in the esophagus is carefully sealed to ensure minimal post-operative risk and faster healing.

sections.heading: Why Choose POEM at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?
benefits: Minimally Invasive, Maximum Results: Say goodbye to the days of large surgical scars and long recovery times. With POEM, most patients can go home the same day or the day after, with a much faster recovery process than traditional surgery.

Tailored to You: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we understand that every patient is unique. Our specialized team works with you to craft a treatment plan that’s tailored to your specific needs, ensuring a smooth, personalized experience.
Advanced Technology: We use the latest in medical technology to ensure that the procedure is done with precision, reducing the chances of complications and optimizing healing.
Compassionate Care: We’re not just a clinic—we’re a partner in your health journey. From the moment you walk in, we focus on providing care that’s compassionate, informative, and empowering.

sections.heading: Is POEM Right for You?
sections.content: If you're struggling with Achalasia and traditional treatments haven’t been effective, POEM might be the solution you've been searching for. Some signs you might be a candidate for POEM include:
symptoms: Difficulty swallowing solid foods and liquids
Weight loss due to trouble eating

sections.heading: What to Expect After POEM
sections.content: While POEM is a minimally invasive procedure, it's important to be prepared for some initial recovery. Here's what you can expect:

recovery.description: Most patients experience only mild discomfort post-procedure, and many return to normal activities within a few days. You'll be able to eat soft foods almost immediately and gradually transition to regular foods.
Thanks to the precision of the technique, recovery is quicker than traditional surgery. With regular follow-up appointments, we ensure that your healing is progressing as it should.
Most patients report significant improvements in swallowing and reduction in symptoms. The majority experience lasting relief, with minimal recurrence of symptoms over time.

faq.question: How long does the POEM procedure take?
faq.answer: POEM typically takes about 1.5 to 2 hours. The procedure is minimally invasive, so you won’t need to stay in the hospital for long.

faq.question: Is POEM painful?
faq.answer: While there might be some discomfort immediately after the procedure, POEM is less painful than traditional surgery, and recovery time is faster. Most patients report only mild soreness or throat discomfort.

faq.question: What is the recovery like?
faq.answer: You can usually go home the same day or the day after the procedure. Many patients return to normal activities within a week. A soft-food diet is recommended for a short period following the procedure.

faq.question: Will POEM cure my Achalasia completely?
faq.answer: POEM is a highly effective treatment, and most patients experience complete or near-complete symptom relief. As with any procedure, outcomes may vary, and we’ll work with you to ensure the best possible result.

sections.heading: Experience the Future of Esophageal Care with POEM at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE
sections.content: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are committed to offering the most advanced treatments available, providing our patients with effective, minimally invasive solutions that significantly improve quality of life. If you or a loved one are dealing with Achalasia, POEM may be the transformative treatment you've been looking for. Let us guide you on the path to better health.
sections.call_to_action: Ready to take the next step? Contact KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE today to schedule your consultation and learn more about how POEM can help you reclaim your health.

advancedprocedures.title: EMR (Endoscopic Mucosal Resection)
advancedprocedures.description: Experience unmatched durability that goes above and beyond with lasting investment.

sections.heading: EMR (Endoscopic Mucosal Resection)
content: Endoscopic Mucosal Resection (EMR) is a minimally invasive technique used to remove early-stage tumors or abnormal growths from the gastrointestinal (GI) tract. This procedure is performed using advanced endoscopic tools, allowing for the removal of cancerous or pre-cancerous cells without the need for invasive surgery.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we prioritize innovation and precision. EMR offers an effective treatment option for a variety of GI tract conditions, including early esophageal, stomach, and colon cancers, as well as non-cancerous polyps. By using EMR, we can provide targeted, effective treatment with minimal discomfort and a faster recovery time.

steps.title: Accessing the Growth
steps.description: The procedure begins with the insertion of the endoscope, which provides a clear, real-time view of the affected area inside your digestive tract. This allows the doctor to accurately locate and assess the abnormal growth.

steps.title: Injection and Lifting
steps.description: A special solution is injected beneath the lesion, causing it to rise or "lift" away from the underlying tissue. This makes it easier to safely remove the growth without damaging healthy tissue.

steps.title: Resection
steps.description: The abnormal tissue is then removed using a specialized tool, such as a snare or suction device, while being monitored under the camera’s guidance. This method ensures precision and minimizes risk.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: The tissue is carefully examined, and the patient is monitored to ensure proper healing. In most cases, you can return home the same day, with a follow-up plan for optimal recovery.

sections.heading: Benefits of EMR
benefits: Minimally invasive, reducing the need for major surgery and minimizing recovery time.
High precision and safety using advanced endoscopic technology.
Quick recovery with minimal downtime and no large incisions.
Expert care from experienced gastroenterologists and specialists.

steps.title: Early-Stage GI Cancers
steps.description: For cancers of the esophagus, stomach, and colon that are still confined to the mucosal layer, EMR offers an effective way to remove the tumor while preserving healthy tissue.

steps.title: Precancerous Lesions
steps.description: Polyps or abnormal growths that have the potential to develop into cancer can be safely and efficiently removed with EMR.

steps.title: Benign Growths
steps.description: Non-cancerous tumors or lesions in the GI tract can also be treated using this technique, preventing further complications.

recovery.description: Since EMR is minimally invasive, recovery is typically quick. Most patients experience only mild discomfort in the days following the procedure, which can be managed with over-the-counter medications.

Most patients can return to normal activities shortly after the procedure. A soft-food diet is usually recommended for a short period following EMR, and your doctor will provide personalized guidelines.

You’ll be scheduled for follow-up visits to ensure proper healing and monitor for any recurrence of abnormal growths. Regular surveillance is key to ensuring long-term health and preventing further issues.

faq.question: How long does EMR take?
faq.answer: EMR usually takes between 30 to 90 minutes, depending on the size and location of the abnormal growth.

faq.question: Is the procedure painful?
faq.answer: EMR is typically well-tolerated with minimal discomfort. Patients may feel some soreness in the throat (if the procedure is done through the mouth) or mild abdominal discomfort afterward.

faq.question: Do I need to stay overnight?
faq.answer: In most cases, EMR is performed on an outpatient basis, meaning you can go home the same day. Some patients may be advised to stay in the hospital for observation if needed.

faq.question: What are the risks of EMR?
faq.answer: While EMR is a safe and effective procedure, there are some risks, including bleeding or perforation (a hole in the wall of the GI tract). However, these complications are rare, and the procedure is closely monitored to minimize risk.

advancedprocedures.title: ESD (Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection)
advancedprocedures.description: Integrate our product into your routine with an intuitive and easy-to-use interface.

sections.heading: ESD (Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection)
content: Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection (ESD) is a procedure designed to remove tumors, lesions, or early-stage cancers from the gastrointestinal (GI) tract. Unlike traditional techniques, ESD allows for the precise removal of larger lesions and tumors in a single piece, reducing the need for more invasive surgery.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are proud to offer this state-of-the-art procedure, using the latest technology to deliver effective, minimally invasive treatment. Whether it's for benign growths or early-stage cancer, ESD offers a solution that ensures safety, accuracy, and quick recovery.

steps.title: Initial Access
steps.description: The procedure begins with the insertion of a thin, flexible endoscope, which provides real-time visuals of the inside of the GI tract. This allows the doctor to locate and assess the abnormal growth or lesion.

steps.title: Injection and Lifting
steps.description: A special solution is injected into the submucosal layer beneath the lesion, lifting it away from the surrounding tissue. This ensures that the abnormal growth is separated and can be removed safely.

steps.title: Precision Dissection
steps.description: Using specialized tools, the lesion is carefully dissected from the surrounding tissue. The goal is to remove the entire tumor or lesion in one piece, reducing the risk of recurrence and ensuring complete excision.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: Once the lesion is removed, the site is monitored for any signs of bleeding or complications. Afterward, the patient is typically able to go home the same day, with follow-up appointments scheduled for recovery and monitoring.

sections.heading: Why Choose ESD at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: Unmatched Precision
steps.description: ESD is the gold standard for removing larger lesions or tumors that are confined to the mucosal layer of the GI tract. This advanced technique allows for more accurate removal compared to traditional methods, reducing the risk of leaving behind any abnormal tissue.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: With no need for large incisions, ESD offers a faster recovery time, less discomfort, and fewer complications compared to traditional surgery. You can get back to your routine sooner, with minimal downtime.

steps.title: Expert Care
steps.description: The team at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE consists of experienced gastroenterologists and specialists who are highly skilled in performing ESD. We ensure that each procedure is done with precision, care, and attention to your individual needs.

steps.title: Comprehensive Treatment
steps.description: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we take a holistic approach to treatment, offering not just cutting-edge procedures but also comprehensive care that focuses on long-term health and well-being.

steps.title: Early-Stage Gastrointestinal Cancers
steps.description: When cancers are confined to the mucosal layer of the GI tract, ESD allows for the precise removal of the tumor without the need for invasive surgery.

steps.title: Benign Tumors and Polyps
steps.description: Non-cancerous growths in the esophagus, stomach, or colon can be effectively removed using ESD, preventing future complications.

steps.title: Precancerous Lesions
steps.description: ESD is also effective in removing precancerous growths or lesions, reducing the risk of these lesions developing into cancer in the future.

recovery.description: Since ESD is minimally invasive, recovery is quick. Most patients can go home the same day with minimal discomfort. Most can return to normal activities within a week or two.

After the procedure, you may be asked to follow a special diet for a short period, along with other instructions to promote healing. Follow-up appointments are scheduled to monitor your recovery and ensure that there are no signs of recurrence.
ESD is a low-risk procedure, though, as with any medical procedure, there are some risks, such as bleeding or perforation. These are rare and carefully managed by our expert team.

faq.question: How long does ESD take?
faq.answer: The procedure typically takes between 1 and 2 hours, depending on the size and location of the lesion.

faq.question: Is ESD painful
faq.answer: ESD is minimally invasive and most patients report only mild discomfort afterward. Local anesthesia is used during the procedure, and patients are closely monitored during recovery.

faq.question: How soon can I return to normal activities?
faq.answer: Most patients can return to their normal activities within a week. A follow-up plan will be provided to monitor healing and recovery.

faq.question: Will I need additional treatment after ESD?
faq.answer: Follow-up appointments are essential for monitoring your recovery and ensuring that there is no recurrence of abnormal tissue. In some cases, additional treatments or surveillance may be necessary, but many patients experience a full recovery after ESD.

advancedprocedures.title: STER (Submucosal Tunneling Endoscopic Resection)
advancedprocedures.description: Stay ahead with features that set new standards, addressing your evolving needs better than the rest.

sections.heading: What is STER?
content: Submucosal Tunneling Endoscopic Resection (STER) is an advanced, minimally invasive technique used to treat tumors and lesions in the gastrointestinal (GI) tract, particularly those located in hard-to-reach areas like the esophagus or the stomach. This innovative procedure allows for the precise and complete removal of abnormal tissue, offering a safer and more effective alternative to traditional surgery.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we provide cutting-edge STER procedures designed to treat gastrointestinal tumors with minimal disruption to surrounding tissues. This modern technique enables us to deliver quicker recovery times, fewer complications, and superior results for our patients.

steps.title: Endoscopic Access
steps.description: The procedure starts with the insertion of an endoscope into the gastrointestinal tract. This endoscope provides real-time visuals, allowing the doctor to precisely locate the tumor or lesion.

steps.title: Tunneling Technique
steps.description: The specialized endoscopic tools create a tunnel in the submucosal layer under the tumor, separating it from the surrounding tissues. This allows the tumor to be safely and effectively removed without the need for large incisions.

steps.title: Lesion Removal
steps.description: Once the tunnel is created, the tumor or lesion is removed in its entirety. This ensures that the abnormal tissue is completely excised, reducing the likelihood of recurrence.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: After the lesion is successfully removed, the site is monitored for any signs of complications. Most patients can go home the same day, and a follow-up plan is established to ensure optimal recovery.

sections.heading: Why Choose STER at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: Stomach and Colonic Tumors
steps.description: Lesions located in the stomach or colon that require precise removal without disrupting surrounding healthy tissue can be treated with STER.

recovery.description: Most patients recover quickly, with many being able to go home the same day as the procedure. Follow-up visits are scheduled to monitor recovery and ensure there are no signs of recurrence.

After the procedure, you may be asked to follow specific guidelines for diet and activity to aid healing. Any necessary follow-up procedures or treatments will be discussed during your recovery appointments.

STER is a low-risk procedure, with rare complications such as bleeding or perforation. These are carefully managed by the team at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy (KAGE), ensuring the best outcomes for our patients.

faq.question: How long does the STER procedure take?
faq.answer: STER typically takes 1 to 2 hours, depending on the size and location of the lesion.

faq.question: Is STER painful?
faq.answer: Most patients report only mild discomfort following the procedure. Local anesthesia is used, and pain is typically minimal due to the minimally invasive nature of the procedure.

faq.question: How soon can I resume normal activities?
faq.answer: You can generally return to your regular routine within a week, though you’ll need to follow any specific care instructions provided by your doctor.

faq.question: Will I need additional treatments after STER?
faq.answer: Follow-up visits are essential to ensure complete recovery and monitor for any recurrence of the abnormal tissue. Additional treatment may be required based on the results of these visits.

advancedprocedures.title: ARMA (Anti-reflux Mucosal Ablation)
advancedprocedures.description: A cutting-edge solution for reflux management with long-term relief.

sections.heading: What is ARMA?
content: Anti-Reflux Mucosal Ablation (ARMA) is a cutting-edge procedure designed to treat Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD) and the damage caused by chronic acid reflux. This minimally invasive treatment targets and ablates (destroys) the abnormal mucosal tissue that develops due to the long-term effects of acid reflux, improving symptoms and preventing further damage to the esophagus.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we offer ARMA as an advanced, safe, and effective solution for GERD patients suffering from persistent heartburn, acid regurgitation, and esophageal damage. This procedure provides long-lasting relief, with a significantly lower risk of complications compared to traditional surgery.

steps.title: Endoscopic Access
steps.description: The procedure is performed using an endoscope, which is a thin, flexible tube with a camera that allows the doctor to view the inside of the esophagus in real-time.

steps.title: Targeted Mucosal Ablation
steps.description: The doctor uses specialized tools to deliver energy to the abnormal mucosal tissue, effectively removing or destroying the damaged cells caused by acid reflux. This process helps to reduce the irritation and inflammation in the esophagus.

steps.title: Healing and Regeneration
steps.description: After the ablation, the esophagus begins to heal and regenerate, replacing the damaged tissue with healthy mucosal lining. This not only improves symptoms but also helps to prevent further damage caused by acid reflux.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: ARMA is minimally invasive, meaning most patients can return home the same day. A follow-up plan is provided to monitor healing and symptom relief.

sections.heading: Why Choose ARMA at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: Effective for GERD-Related Damage
steps.description: ARMA specifically targets the mucosal damage caused by GERD, helping to reduce symptoms like heartburn and regurgitation while preventing long-term complications such as esophageal stricture or Barrett’s esophagus.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: Unlike traditional surgeries, ARMA is performed using an endoscope, which requires no incisions. This means less discomfort, a faster recovery, and a significantly lower risk of complications.

steps.title: Long-Lasting Relief
steps.description: By addressing the root cause of GERD-related damage, ARMA provides lasting relief from the chronic symptoms of acid reflux, helping patients to regain their quality of life.

steps.description: If GERD has led to complications such as esophageal inflammation, ulcers, or even Barrett’s esophagus, ARMA can help reverse or prevent further damage.

steps.title: Persistent Heartburn
steps.description: For patients who suffer from chronic heartburn despite lifestyle changes and medication, ARMA offers a treatment option to address the underlying tissue damage.

recovery.description: Most patients can return to normal activities within a few days after the procedure. Since it’s minimally invasive, the healing process is quicker compared to traditional surgery.

After the procedure, you’ll be asked to follow a modified diet and avoid certain activities to help your esophagus heal. A follow-up visit will be scheduled to monitor your recovery and assess symptom improvement.

ARMA is a low-risk procedure, with rare complications such as infection or bleeding. These risks are closely managed by the expert team at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy (KAGE) to ensure the best outcomes.

faq.question: How long does the ARMA procedure take?
faq.answer: The ARMA procedure typically takes about 30 to 45 minutes, depending on the extent of mucosal damage.

faq.question: Is ARMA painful?
faq.answer: ARMA is performed under mild sedation, so most patients report little to no pain during the procedure. Any discomfort afterward is usually minimal and temporary.

faq.question: How soon can I resume normal activities?
faq.answer: Patients can generally return to their normal activities within 1 to 3 days. You may be asked to avoid heavy lifting or strenuous activities for a short period.

faq.question: How soon will I notice relief from GERD symptoms?
faq.answer: Many patients begin to feel relief from GERD symptoms within a few weeks after the procedure. Symptom improvement may continue over the course of several months as the esophagus heals.

advancedprocedures.title: GERDx (Anti-Reflux Mucosal Ablation Therapy)
advancedprocedures.description: Effective anti-reflux therapy designed to provide relief and improve patient outcomes.

sections.heading: What is GERDx?
content: GERDx (Anti-Reflux Mucosal Ablation Therapy) is a revolutionary, minimally invasive procedure designed to treat Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD) and the damage it causes to the esophagus. GERD is a chronic condition where acid from the stomach frequently flows back into the esophagus, leading to persistent heartburn, acid regurgitation, and even damage to the esophageal lining. GERDx offers a targeted approach to treat the underlying damage by ablation of the abnormal tissue, leading to long-term relief and prevention of further complications.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we offer the latest in GERDx therapy, providing an effective and safe solution for those suffering from chronic acid reflux. This advanced treatment addresses both the symptoms and the underlying tissue damage, helping you feel better and live without the discomfort of GERD.

steps.title: Endoscopic Examination
steps.description: The procedure begins with an endoscope, a flexible tube with a camera, that allows the doctor to view the esophagus in real-time. This helps locate areas of damage caused by acid reflux.

steps.title: Targeted Mucosal Ablation
steps.description: The doctor then uses specialized instruments to apply controlled energy to the affected areas of the esophagus. This energy carefully removes or destroys the damaged tissue, promoting healing and reducing the risk of further complications such as strictures or ulcers.

steps.title: Healing Process
steps.description: After the ablation, the healthy tissue in the esophagus begins to regenerate, replacing the damaged areas. This regeneration leads to improved function, symptom reduction, and a reduction in the frequency and severity of GERD-related discomfort.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Recovery
steps.description: Since GERDx is minimally invasive, most patients can go home the same day and resume normal activities within a short time. A follow-up plan is established to monitor healing and symptom relief.

steps.description: GERDx addresses the root cause of GERD-related damage, offering lasting relief from acid reflux symptoms and preventing long-term damage to the esophagus.

After GERDx, you may need to follow specific dietary and activity recommendations for a short period to help the healing process. You’ll be given detailed instructions on how to care for yourself post-procedure.

Regular follow-up visits will be scheduled to monitor your recovery and ensure that the esophagus is healing properly. Additional treatments may be necessary based on your recovery and ongoing symptoms.

faq.question: How long does the GERDx procedure take?
faq.answer: The procedure typically takes 30 to 60 minutes, depending on the extent of the tissue damage. It’s a quick and efficient treatment with minimal disruption to your daily life.

faq.question: Is GERDx painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience little to no discomfort during the procedure as sedation is used. After the procedure, any discomfort is generally mild and can be managed with over-the-counter pain relief if necessary.

faq.question: How soon can I resume normal activities after GERDx?
faq.answer: Patients typically return to normal activities within 1-2 days. You may be asked to avoid strenuous activities for a brief period to allow the esophagus to heal properly.

faq.question: Will GERDx cure my GERD?
faq.answer: While GERDx addresses the mucosal damage caused by GERD and offers long-term relief, it is important to continue managing your GERD with lifestyle changes and medication as prescribed by your doctor. This combined approach helps to keep your symptoms under control.

advancedprocedures.title: FTRD (Full-Thickness Resection Device)
advancedprocedures.description: Innovative technology for precise tissue resection and minimal complications.

sections.heading: What is FTRD?
content: The Full-Thickness Resection Device (FTRD) is a groundbreaking, minimally invasive procedure designed to treat benign tumors, polyps, and other abnormal growths in the colon and rectum. Unlike traditional surgery, FTRD uses advanced endoscopic techniques to remove full-thickness lesions (tumors or polyps that extend through all layers of the bowel wall) with precision and minimal discomfort. This advanced treatment offers a safer, more efficient alternative to traditional surgeries, leading to faster recovery and fewer complications.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are proud to offer the latest in FTRD treatment, delivering cutting-edge care to patients seeking a reliable and less invasive solution for their colorectal health concerns.

steps.title: Endoscopic Examination
steps.description: The procedure begins with an endoscopic camera being inserted into the colon or rectum. This allows your doctor to view the lesion or growth in real-time, ensuring precise targeting for removal.

steps.title: Full-Thickness Resection
steps.description: The FTRD device is then carefully deployed, using suction to hold the lesion in place before performing a full-thickness removal of the tissue. This ensures that the entire lesion is removed, including deeper layers of the bowel wall that may harbor abnormal cells.

steps.title: Tissue Removal and Healing
steps.description: After the lesion is removed, the healthy tissue surrounding it remains intact. The bowel wall heals quickly, and the risk of complications, such as bleeding or perforation, is significantly reduced compared to traditional surgery.

steps.title: Minimal Recovery Time
steps.description: Since the procedure is minimally invasive and performed endoscopically, patients typically experience less pain, shorter recovery times, and a quicker return to normal activities.

sections.heading: Why Choose FTRD at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: FTRD is performed through a small endoscope inserted into the bowel, meaning no incisions are required. This results in less pain, faster recovery, and a significantly lower risk of complications compared to traditional surgical methods.

steps.title: Precision and Effectiveness
steps.description: The FTRD offers highly precise removal of full-thickness lesions, ensuring that all abnormal tissue is carefully excised while preserving healthy tissue. This precision leads to improved outcomes and fewer chances of recurrence.

steps.title: Faster Recovery
steps.description: With minimal disruption to surrounding tissues, most patients recover quickly and can resume their daily activities within a short time frame.

steps.title: Expert Care at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE
steps.description: Our skilled gastroenterologists specialize in performing FTRD procedures using the latest techniques and equipment. You can trust our team to provide the best care, personalized to your unique health needs.

steps.title: Benign Polyps
steps.description: Growths in the colon or rectum that may have the potential to develop into cancer if left untreated.

steps.title: Colorectal Tumors
steps.description: Non-cancerous tumors that may need to be removed to prevent further complications.

steps.title: Precancerous Lesions
steps.description: Abnormal growths or cells that have the potential to become cancerous over time.

steps.title: Early-stage Colorectal Cancer
steps.description: In some cases, FTRD can be used to remove early-stage cancers confined to the colon or rectum.

sections.heading: What to Expect After FTRD
sections.content:
- Quick Recovery: Since FTRD is a minimally invasive procedure, most patients experience only mild discomfort after the procedure and are able to return home the same day. You can typically resume normal activities within a few days.

- Post-Procedure Care: You will be provided with detailed aftercare instructions, including dietary recommendations and guidelines to help you heal. It is important to follow these instructions carefully for the best results.

- Follow-Up Appointments: You’ll be scheduled for follow-up visits to monitor your recovery and ensure that no further abnormal growths develop. If necessary, additional procedures can be scheduled to address any ongoing concerns.

faq.question: Is FTRD painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience minimal discomfort during and after the procedure, especially compared to traditional surgery. Any discomfort can usually be managed with over-the-counter pain medication.

faq.question: How long does the FTRD procedure take?
faq.answer: The procedure typically takes about 30-60 minutes, depending on the complexity and size of the lesion being removed.

faq.question: Will I need to stay in the hospital after FTRD?
faq.answer: No, FTRD is typically done on an outpatient basis, meaning most patients can go home the same day.

faq.question: How soon can I return to normal activities?
faq.answer: Most patients are able to resume their normal activities within 1-2 days after the procedure. Strenuous activities should be avoided for a short period to allow for proper healing.

faq.question: Is FTRD a permanent solution?
faq.answer: FTRD provides a permanent removal of the target lesion. However, regular monitoring and follow-up care are necessary to ensure no new growths develop.

advancedprocedures.title: EUS- Biliary Drainage
advancedprocedures.description: Advanced procedure for biliary drainage using Endoscopic Ultrasound.

sections.heading: What is EUS Biliary Drainage?
content: EUS (Endoscopic Ultrasound)-guided Biliary Drainage is a minimally invasive procedure used to treat patients with blocked bile ducts or gallstones that are causing biliary obstructions. It is an advanced technique that combines endoscopy with ultrasound imaging to deliver accurate, real-time visual guidance for drainage. This procedure helps relieve symptoms associated with bile duct blockages, such as jaundice, pain, and digestive issues, while avoiding the need for traditional surgery.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are committed to providing the latest in gastroenterology treatments, including EUS-guided biliary drainage, ensuring faster recovery, reduced risk, and enhanced outcomes for our patients.

steps.title: Endoscopic Ultrasound
steps.description: An endoscope, which is a flexible tube with a camera, is inserted through the mouth into the stomach and small intestine. Using ultrasound imaging, the gastroenterologist can visualize the bile ducts and surrounding structures in real-time.

steps.title: Guiding the Drainage
steps.description: Once the blockage or obstruction is located, the doctor uses a needle or catheter to access the bile duct from the inside of the digestive tract. Through this guided approach, a stent (a small tube) is placed in the bile duct to bypass the obstruction and allow bile to flow freely.

steps.title: Biliary Drainage
steps.description: The stent helps to drain the bile from the liver, reducing the symptoms of jaundice and improving liver function. In some cases, the stent may remain in place for long-term management, while in other cases, it may be removed once the blockage resolves.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive Approach
steps.description: Unlike traditional surgery, EUS-guided biliary drainage requires only small incisions or no incisions at all, which results in a quicker recovery time, reduced risk of complications, and minimal discomfort for the patient.

sections.heading: Why Choose EUS Biliary Drainage at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: State-of-the-Art Technology

steps.title: Cholestasis
steps.description: A condition where bile flow is reduced or blocked, causing bile to accumulate in the liver.

steps.description: Narrowing of the bile ducts, often due to chronic inflammation or scarring.

steps.description: Regular follow-up visits are crucial to ensure that the bile duct remains clear and functioning. The stent may need to be replaced periodically, depending on your condition and the type of stent used.

faq.question: Is EUS biliary drainage painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience little to no pain during the procedure. Local anesthesia is used to ensure comfort, and post-procedure discomfort is usually mild and temporary.

faq.question: How long does the procedure take?
faq.answer: EUS-guided biliary drainage typically takes about 30-60 minutes, depending on the complexity of the case.

faq.question: Will I need to stay in the hospital after the procedure?

faq.question: How soon can I return to normal activities?

faq.question: What are the risks of EUS biliary drainage?

advancedprocedures.title: EUS- GJ (Gastrojejunostomy)
advancedprocedures.description: A minimally invasive approach to treating obstructed gastric bypasses.

sections.heading: What is EUS-GJ?
content: EUS-GJ (Endoscopic Ultrasound-Guided Gastrojejunostomy) is an advanced, minimally invasive procedure used to bypass blockages or obstructions in the upper gastrointestinal tract, specifically in the stomach. This procedure involves using endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) to guide the creation of a new connection between the stomach and the jejunum (a part of the small intestine), ensuring proper food and fluid passage. It’s an innovative approach for patients who cannot undergo traditional surgical procedures due to medical conditions, making it a game-changer for digestive health.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are at the forefront of EUS-GJ, providing patients with cutting-edge treatments that offer faster recovery, minimal discomfort, and long-term relief from digestive issues.

steps.title: Endoscopic Ultrasound
steps.description: Using a flexible endoscope with an ultrasound probe at its tip, your doctor will carefully examine your stomach, duodenum, and jejunum to identify any blockages or obstructions preventing normal digestion.

steps.title: Precise Navigation
steps.description: With real-time ultrasound guidance, the gastroenterologist will navigate the endoscope to the exact location of the blockage. This allows for precise visualization and mapping without the need for open surgery.

steps.title: Creating the Gastrojejunostomy
steps.description: The doctor uses specialized tools to create a new connection between the stomach and the jejunum. This allows food and fluids to bypass the obstructed area, ensuring normal digestion and reducing symptoms like nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

steps.title: Minimal Invasiveness
steps.description: The entire procedure is done through the mouth, eliminating the need for large incisions and reducing the risk of infection and recovery time typically associated with traditional surgery.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: EUS-GJ is performed without the need for open surgery, reducing the risk of complications and minimizing post-procedure pain.

steps.title: Fast Recovery
steps.description: Patients can typically return to normal activities within a few days, as the procedure is less invasive and requires fewer resources compared to traditional surgeries.

steps.title: Improved Quality of Life
steps.description: By bypassing blockages in the stomach, EUS-GJ helps alleviate symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and malnutrition, improving overall well-being and digestive function.

steps.title: High Precision
steps.description: The combination of endoscopy and ultrasound guidance ensures the most accurate placement of the gastrojejunostomy, leading to better outcomes and fewer complications.

steps.title: Gastric Outlet Obstruction
steps.description: A condition where the passage from the stomach to the small intestine is blocked, leading to issues with food passage and digestion.

steps.title: Cancer
steps.description: Malignant tumors, particularly in the stomach, pancreas, or duodenum, can cause obstruction and prevent normal food movement through the digestive system.

steps.title: Peptic Ulcers and Scar Tissue
steps.description: Chronic ulcers or scarring caused by previous surgeries can create blockages in the digestive tract.

steps.title: Crohn's Disease
steps.description: Inflammatory bowel disease like Crohn's can cause narrowing of the intestines, leading to blockages and difficulties in digestion.

steps.title: Pancreatitis
steps.description: Chronic inflammation of the pancreas may lead to severe complications like duodenal obstructions, which EUS-GJ can effectively bypass.

steps.title: Recovery Time
steps.description: Most patients recover quickly after EUS-GJ, with minimal discomfort and a short hospital stay. You can generally resume eating soft foods within a few days.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: After the procedure, you will be monitored for a short period to ensure that the new connection between the stomach and jejunum is functioning properly. You may be advised to avoid heavy meals for a few days to allow the procedure site to heal.

steps.title: Long-Term Management
steps.description: Patients who undergo EUS-GJ may need follow-up care to ensure the connection remains open and functioning. However, the need for re-intervention is rare.

sections.heading: Why Choose EUS-GJ at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: State-of-the-Art Technology
steps.description: KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE is committed to using the most advanced technology available for EUS-GJ. Our endoscopic ultrasound equipment offers precise guidance, ensuring the procedure is as effective and safe as possible.

steps.title: Expert Care Team
steps.description: Our team of experienced gastroenterologists is skilled in performing EUS-GJ, providing expert care tailored to your specific needs. We work closely with you to determine the best course of action for your condition.

steps.title: Patient-Centered Approach
steps.description: We believe in providing comprehensive care that focuses on your comfort and well-being. From your initial consultation to post-procedure follow-up, we are here to guide you every step of the way.

faq.question: Is EUS-GJ painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience minimal discomfort during and after the procedure, as it is minimally invasive. Sedation is used to ensure comfort, and any post-procedure discomfort can be managed with over-the-counter pain medication.

faq.question: How long does the procedure take?
faq.answer: The procedure typically lasts about 1-2 hours, depending on the complexity of the case.

faq.question: Will I need to stay in the hospital after the procedure?
faq.answer: In most cases, EUS-GJ is performed on an outpatient basis, and you can go home the same day. However, if any complications arise, you may need to stay in the hospital for observation.

faq.question: How soon can I eat after the procedure?
faq.answer: You will likely be able to eat soft foods within a few days after the procedure, but you should avoid heavy or hard-to-digest meals initially. Your doctor will provide specific dietary instructions.

faq.question: Are there risks associated with EUS-GJ?
faq.answer: While EUS-GJ is a safe procedure, like any medical treatment, it carries some risks, including infection, bleeding, or perforation of the gastrointestinal tract. However, these risks are minimal and are carefully monitored by our expert team.

advancedprocedures.title: EUS- RF Ablation
advancedprocedures.description: Revolutionary treatment option using radiofrequency for enhanced therapeutic results.

sections.heading: What is EUS-RF Ablation?
content: EUS-RF Ablation (Endoscopic Ultrasound-Guided Radiofrequency Ablation) is a minimally invasive procedure that uses high-frequency radio waves to target and destroy abnormal tissues or tumors in the digestive tract. Guided by Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS), this procedure offers unparalleled precision in treating gastrointestinal cancers and other lesions by directly targeting the affected tissue, minimizing harm to surrounding healthy areas.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are committed to providing advanced, patient-centered treatments like EUS-RF Ablation that are designed to offer effective results with fewer complications, faster recovery, and a more comfortable experience.

steps.title: Precise Imaging with EUS
steps.description: Your gastroenterologist uses an endoscope with an ultrasound probe at its tip to visualize the lesion or tumor within your gastrointestinal tract. This allows for real-time imaging of the affected area, ensuring accurate targeting.

steps.title: Radiofrequency Energy Delivery
steps.description: Once the tumor or abnormal tissue is located, a specialized catheter is introduced through the endoscope, and radiofrequency energy is applied directly to the target tissue. This energy generates heat, which causes the tissue to coagulate and ultimately be destroyed.

steps.title: Minimal Discomfort, High Precision
steps.description: The procedure is typically performed under mild sedation, making it comfortable for patients. The combination of EUS and radiofrequency energy ensures that the treatment is precise, offering minimal risk of damage to surrounding tissues.

steps.title: Outpatient Procedure
steps.description: EUS-RF Ablation is performed as an outpatient procedure, allowing you to go home the same day and resume normal activities after a short recovery period.

points.title: Targeted Treatment
points.description: With EUS providing real-time imaging, the procedure allows for accurate targeting of tumors or abnormal tissue without the need for open surgery, ensuring high precision.

points.title: Minimally Invasive
points.description: The procedure does not require large incisions, reducing the risk of complications, infection, and scarring.

points.title: Faster Recovery
points.description: Most patients experience a quick recovery, returning to normal activities within a few days due to the minimally invasive nature of the procedure.

points.title: Reduced Pain
points.description: Because EUS-RF Ablation involves no major cuts or incisions, patients typically report less pain and discomfort compared to traditional surgical options.

points.title: Versatility
points.description: EUS-RF Ablation is used for a range of conditions, including early-stage gastrointestinal cancers, precancerous lesions, and other benign growths, making it a versatile treatment option for many patients.

steps.title: Gastrointestinal Cancers
steps.description: Including tumors in the esophagus, stomach, pancreas, and colon.

steps.title: Pre-cancerous Lesions
steps.description: Early stages of cancer or abnormal tissue growth that have not yet spread.

steps.title: Pancreatic Tumors
steps.description: EUS-RF Ablation can be used to treat tumors in the pancreas that are difficult to access using traditional surgery.

steps.title: Barrett’s Esophagus
steps.description: A condition that increases the risk of esophageal cancer, where EUS-RF Ablation helps remove abnormal cells.

steps.title: Benign Tumors
steps.description: Non-cancerous growths in the digestive tract that require removal to improve function or alleviate symptoms.

sections.heading: What to Expect After EUS-RF Ablation

steps.title: Recovery
steps.description: Since EUS-RF Ablation is minimally invasive, recovery time is typically short. You can expect to be monitored for a few hours following the procedure and, in most cases, can go home the same day.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: You may be advised to rest for a few days and gradually return to normal activities. Mild discomfort or swelling at the treatment site is common but usually resolves quickly. Your doctor will guide you on dietary restrictions and lifestyle changes for optimal healing.

steps.title: Follow-Up
steps.description: After the procedure, follow-up appointments will be scheduled to monitor the treatment area and ensure the tumor or abnormal tissue has been successfully treated. Your doctor may recommend additional imaging to check for any changes.

steps.description: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we use state-of-the-art EUS and RF Ablation technology to deliver targeted, effective treatments with minimal discomfort and quicker recovery times.

steps.description: Our gastroenterologists and oncologists are highly trained in performing EUS-RF Ablation, with years of experience in managing complex gastrointestinal conditions.

faq.question: Is EUS-RF Ablation painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience minimal pain during and after the procedure. Sedation is used to ensure your comfort, and any post-procedure discomfort can typically be managed with over-the-counter pain medication.

faq.question: How long does the procedure take?
faq.answer: The procedure usually takes between 1-2 hours, depending on the size and location of the lesion or tumor.

faq.question: What is the recovery time after EUS-RF Ablation?
faq.answer: You will be monitored for a few hours after the procedure and may go home the same day. Most patients can resume normal activities within a few days.

faq.question: How effective is EUS-RF Ablation for treating cancer?
faq.answer: EUS-RF Ablation is highly effective for early-stage cancers, pre-cancerous lesions, and benign tumors. Your doctor will discuss the likelihood of success based on your specific condition.

faq.question: Are there any risks associated with EUS-RF Ablation?
faq.answer: While EUS-RF Ablation is considered a safe procedure, there are potential risks, including bleeding, infection, or injury to surrounding tissues. These risks are minimal and carefully managed by our skilled team.

advancedprocedures.title: EUS Cystogastrostomy
advancedprocedures.description: Endoscopic ultrasound-assisted technique for drainage of pancreatic cysts.

sections.heading: What is EUS Cystogastrostomy?
content: EUS Cystogastrostomy is a cutting-edge, minimally invasive procedure used to drain fluid-filled cysts in the pancreas or gastrointestinal tract. This procedure, performed under the guidance of Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS), creates a direct connection between the cyst and the stomach to allow the contents to drain safely, alleviating symptoms and preventing complications such as infection or rupture.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we are dedicated to offering innovative treatments like EUS Cystogastrostomy that provide precise, effective results with minimal recovery time. This procedure can significantly improve the quality of life for patients with pancreatic or gastrointestinal cysts, often avoiding the need for more invasive surgery.

steps.title: Imaging with EUS
steps.description: A specialized endoscope with an ultrasound probe is inserted through the mouth into the stomach. This allows your doctor to visualize the cyst and surrounding structures in real-time. The ultrasound provides clear, high-resolution images, ensuring precise targeting of the cyst.

steps.title: Creation of a Stoma
steps.description: Using the EUS imaging guidance, a small incision is made in the stomach wall, creating a stoma (opening) that connects the cyst to the stomach. This connection allows the fluid in the cyst to drain into the stomach, where it can be safely absorbed or eliminated.

steps.title: Drainage
steps.description: A catheter or stent is inserted through the newly created opening to maintain the drainage and prevent the cyst from re-filling. This step ensures the cyst remains drained for as long as necessary to prevent further complications.

steps.title: Minimal Recovery Time
steps.description: The procedure is typically done under mild sedation, and since it is minimally invasive, patients often experience a much shorter recovery time compared to traditional surgery.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: The procedure requires no large incisions, reducing the risk of infection and other complications associated with traditional surgery.

steps.title: Targeted Treatment
steps.description: EUS provides real-time imaging that ensures the cyst is drained with high precision, offering effective treatment with minimal disruption to surrounding tissues.

steps.title: Faster Recovery
steps.description: Most patients can go home the same day, with a faster recovery time compared to open surgery.

steps.title: Reduced Pain and Discomfort
steps.description: As the procedure involves no large cuts or stitches, patients generally experience less pain and discomfort post-treatment.

steps.title: Preventing Complications
steps.description: EUS Cystogastrostomy helps prevent complications associated with cysts, such as rupture, infection, or obstruction, providing lasting relief.

steps.title: Pancreatic Cysts
steps.description: Fluid-filled sacs within the pancreas that may cause pain, infection, or other complications.

steps.title: Pseudocysts
steps.description: Typically formed after pancreatic inflammation or injury, these cysts can lead to abdominal pain or infection if not treated.

steps.title: Mucinous Cysts
steps.description: Potentially precancerous cysts found in the pancreas that require drainage to prevent complications.

steps.title: Other Gastrointestinal Cysts
steps.description: Cysts in the stomach or surrounding areas that can cause discomfort or other health issues.

sections.heading: What to Expect After EUS Cystogastrostomy

steps.title: Recovery
steps.description: Since EUS Cystogastrostomy is a minimally invasive procedure, recovery is quick. Most patients are able to go home on the same day, with only mild discomfort.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: You may be asked to avoid certain foods or activities for a short period to allow the stomach to heal and the drainage to stabilize. Mild pain or bloating is common but usually resolves within a few days.

steps.title: Follow-Up Appointments
steps.description: Regular follow-up visits will be scheduled to monitor the cyst and ensure proper drainage. In some cases, the stent may be removed once the cyst is sufficiently drained.

sections.heading: Why Choose EUS Cystogastrostomy at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE?

steps.title: State-of-the-Art Technology
steps.description: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we use the latest EUS and endoscopic technology to ensure the highest level of precision and care during your procedure.

steps.title: Expert Medical Team
steps.description: Our team of highly skilled gastroenterologists and endoscopists has extensive experience in performing EUS Cystogastrostomy, ensuring you receive the best possible care.

steps.title: Patient-Centered Approach
steps.description: We understand that each patient’s needs are unique. Our team works closely with you to provide a treatment plan tailored to your specific condition, ensuring a smooth and successful outcome.

faq.question: Is EUS Cystogastrostomy painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience minimal discomfort during the procedure as sedation is used. Any post-procedure discomfort is usually mild and can be managed with over-the-counter pain relievers.

faq.question: How long does the procedure take?
faq.answer: The procedure typically takes between 1 to 2 hours, depending on the complexity of the cyst and its location.

faq.question: What is the recovery time?
faq.answer: You can typically return home the same day. Recovery time is fast, with most patients resuming normal activities within a few days.

faq.question: What risks are associated with EUS Cystogastrostomy?
faq.answer: Though EUS Cystogastrostomy is considered safe, there are minor risks such as infection, bleeding, or injury to nearby organs. These risks are minimized due to the precision of the procedure.

faq.question: How effective is EUS Cystogastrostomy?
faq.answer: EUS Cystogastrostomy is highly effective for draining pancreatic and gastrointestinal cysts, with a high success rate in preventing complications like infection or rupture.

advancedprocedures.title: Endoscopic Necrosectomy
advancedprocedures.description: Minimally invasive procedure for managing pancreatic necrosis.

sections.heading: What is Endoscopic Necrosectomy?
content: Endoscopic Necrosectomy is a state-of-the-art procedure used to treat severe cases of pancreatic necrosis, a serious condition where parts of the pancreas die due to infection or inflammation. This procedure allows for the safe removal of necrotic tissue using a minimally invasive endoscopic approach, providing a more effective and less invasive alternative to traditional surgery.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we specialize in cutting-edge treatments like Endoscopic Necrosectomy, offering patients a faster recovery time, reduced complications, and a significantly lower risk than open surgery.

steps.title: Imaging Guidance
steps.description: The procedure begins with imaging studies, such as CT scans or ultrasound, to identify the location and extent of necrotic tissue in the pancreas.

steps.title: Endoscopic Access
steps.description: A flexible tube with a camera (endoscope) is inserted through the mouth and into the stomach and small intestine. The endoscope is equipped with various instruments that allow for precise visualization and removal of the necrotic tissue.

steps.title: Necrotic Tissue Removal
steps.description: Using specialized tools, our expert team carefully removes the dead tissue from the pancreas. This is done through small access points created in the stomach or intestine, with minimal disruption to surrounding organs.

steps.title: Drainage Placement
steps.description: In many cases, a drain or stent is placed to ensure that any remaining fluid from the pancreas is safely drained, promoting healing and preventing further infection.

steps.title: Minimal Recovery Time
steps.description: Since the procedure is minimally invasive, recovery is typically quick, with most patients experiencing less pain and returning to their normal activities much sooner than with traditional surgery.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: Unlike traditional open surgery, Endoscopic Necrosectomy requires only small incisions, reducing the risk of infection, blood loss, and complications.

steps.title: Faster Recovery
steps.description: Most patients recover faster than with open surgery, often going home the same day or within a few days after the procedure.

steps.title: Reduced Pain
steps.description: Smaller incisions mean less post-operative pain and a quicker return to daily activities.

steps.title: Precision
steps.description: With the help of real-time imaging and endoscopic tools, we can target and remove the necrotic tissue with great accuracy, minimizing damage to surrounding healthy tissue.

steps.title: Lower Risk of Complications
steps.description: The endoscopic approach minimizes the risk of complications such as infection, bleeding, and organ damage that are more common with traditional surgery.

steps.title: Infected Pancreatic Necrosis
steps.description: This occurs when part of the pancreas dies due to severe inflammation or pancreatitis, leading to infection.

steps.title: Pancreatic Abscesses
steps.description: Pockets of infection that can form in the pancreas as a result of necrosis.

steps.title: Pancreatic Fluid Collections
steps.description: Fluid-filled areas that form in the pancreas after injury or pancreatitis and can become infected or infected with necrotic tissue.

sections.heading: What to Expect After Endoscopic Necrosectomy

steps.title: Recovery
steps.description: Most patients can expect a faster recovery compared to traditional surgery. The procedure is minimally invasive, so pain and hospital stay are minimized.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: You may be asked to stay on a liquid diet for a few days to allow your digestive system to recover. You may also be monitored for any potential complications, though these are rare due to the minimally invasive nature of the procedure.

steps.title: Follow-Up Appointments
steps.description: Regular follow-up appointments will be necessary to monitor the healing process and ensure that the infection has been cleared and the necrotic tissue is fully removed.

sections.heading: Why Choose Endoscopic Necrosectomy at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE

steps.title: Advanced Technology
steps.description: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we use the latest endoscopic and imaging technology, ensuring the highest precision and success in treating pancreatic necrosis with Endoscopic Necrosectomy.

steps.title: Experienced Specialists
steps.description: Our team of skilled gastroenterologists and endoscopists have extensive experience in performing Endoscopic Necrosectomy and other minimally invasive procedures, ensuring you receive top-quality care.

steps.title: Personalized Care
steps.description: We understand that each patient’s condition is unique. Our team takes a personalized approach to treatment, designing a plan tailored to your specific needs for the best possible outcome.

faq.question: Is Endoscopic Necrosectomy painful?
faq.answer: Most patients experience minimal discomfort as the procedure is done with sedation. Post-procedure pain is usually mild and can be controlled with medication.

faq.question: How long does the procedure take?
faq.answer: The procedure typically lasts between 1 to 3 hours, depending on the complexity and extent of necrotic tissue that needs to be removed.

faq.question: What is the recovery time?
faq.answer: Since Endoscopic Necrosectomy is minimally invasive, most patients can go home within a few days. Full recovery may take a few weeks, depending on the extent of the infection and the individual’s overall health.

faq.question: What are the risks of Endoscopic Necrosectomy?
faq.answer: While the risks of Endoscopic Necrosectomy are lower than traditional surgery, there are potential risks such as infection, bleeding, or damage to nearby organs. However, these risks are rare, and the procedure’s precision reduces their likelihood.

faq.question: How effective is Endoscopic Necrosectomy?
faq.answer: Endoscopic Necrosectomy has a high success rate in treating infected pancreatic necrosis, with many patients experiencing significant relief from their symptoms and avoiding the need for open surgery.

advancedprocedures.title: ERCP- Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography
advancedprocedures.description: A diagnostic and therapeutic procedure to treat biliary and pancreatic disorders.

sections.heading: What is ERCP?
content: Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) is a specialized procedure that combines endoscopy and fluoroscopy to diagnose and treat issues in the bile ducts, pancreatic ducts, and gallbladder. This minimally invasive procedure is used to identify conditions such as gallstones, pancreatitis, bile duct blockages, and more, all while providing immediate treatment when necessary.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we offer ERCP as part of our comprehensive digestive care services, enabling precise diagnosis and treatment with minimal discomfort and quicker recovery.

sections.heading: How ERCP Works
sections.content:
The ERCP procedure involves the use of a flexible tube with a camera (endoscope) inserted through the mouth, into the esophagus, stomach, and small intestine. Once the endoscope reaches the duodenum, a special dye is injected into the bile and pancreatic ducts to make them visible on X-ray images, allowing our expert team to identify blockages, stones, or other issues.

If needed, therapeutic interventions such as stone removal, stent placement, or dilation of narrowed ducts can be performed during the same procedure.

steps.title: Sedation
steps.description: You will be given a sedative to ensure comfort during the procedure.

steps.title: Endoscope Insertion
steps.description: The endoscope is gently passed through the mouth and into the small intestine.

steps.title: Dye Injection
steps.description: A contrast dye is injected into the bile or pancreatic ducts to make them visible on X-ray.

steps.title: Diagnosis & Treatment
steps.description: If blockages, stones, or other abnormalities are detected, treatment options like stone removal, duct dilation, or stent placement may be carried out immediately.

steps.title: Gallstones
steps.description: Stones that form in the gallbladder and may block the bile ducts, causing pain, nausea, or jaundice.

steps.title: Bile Duct Obstruction
steps.description: Blockages in the bile duct due to stones, tumors, or strictures.

steps.title: Pancreatitis
steps.description: Inflammation of the pancreas, often caused by gallstones or blockages in the bile duct.

steps.title: Biliary Strictures
steps.description: Narrowing of the bile duct due to scarring or inflammation.

steps.title: Pancreatic Duct Abnormalities
steps.description: Issues such as blockages or narrowing in the pancreatic duct that affect the flow of digestive enzymes.

steps.title: Sphincter of Oddi Dysfunction
steps.description: Dysfunction of the muscle controlling the flow of bile and pancreatic juices into the small intestine.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: Unlike traditional surgery, ERCP requires only small incisions or no incisions at all, reducing the risk of infection and shortening recovery time.

steps.title: Diagnostic and Therapeutic
steps.description: ERCP not only provides an accurate diagnosis but also allows for immediate treatment, such as stone removal or stent placement, in a single procedure.

steps.title: Quick Recovery
steps.description: Most patients experience minimal downtime and can resume normal activities within a short time, typically within a day or two.

steps.title: Real-Time Imaging
steps.description: The use of X-ray during the procedure allows for immediate visualization, ensuring precise treatment of the bile and pancreatic ducts.

sections.heading: What to Expect During and After ERCP

steps.title: During the Procedure
steps.description: The procedure typically lasts between 30 minutes to an hour. You will be sedated, so you should not feel any pain or discomfort during the process. However, you may experience some bloating or cramping afterward.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: After the procedure, you will be monitored for a short time as the sedative wears off. Most patients can go home the same day, though you may need someone to drive you home.

steps.title: Recovery Time
steps.description: Recovery from ERCP is usually quick, with most patients able to return to normal activities within a day or two. Mild discomfort such as bloating or a sore throat (from the endoscope) is common but temporary.

sections.heading: Why Choose ERCP at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE

steps.title: Expert Care
steps.description: Our team of gastroenterologists and specialists at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE has extensive experience with ERCP, ensuring that you receive the most advanced care for your condition.

steps.description: We use the latest endoscopic and imaging technologies for precise diagnostics and treatment, ensuring optimal results.

steps.title: Personalized Treatment Plans
steps.description: Each patient is unique, and we tailor treatment plans based on your individual health needs and condition.

steps.title: Comprehensive Digestive Care

faq.question: Is ERCP painful?
faq.answer: The procedure is performed under sedation, so you won’t feel any pain during the procedure. Some mild discomfort, such as bloating or a sore throat, may occur afterward, but these symptoms are temporary.

faq.question: How long does ERCP take?
faq.answer: ERCP typically takes between 30 minutes to an hour, depending on whether treatment is needed during the procedure.

faq.question: What are the risks of ERCP?
faq.answer: Although ERCP is generally safe, there are some risks, including infection, bleeding, perforation of the bile duct or intestine, and pancreatitis. However, these risks are rare and are minimized with careful monitoring and expert technique.

faq.question: How soon can I go back to normal activities after ERCP?
faq.answer: Most patients can resume their normal activities within a day or two after the procedure. You may need to avoid strenuous activities for a short period, depending on your doctor’s advice.

faq.question: Will I need follow-up care after ERCP?
faq.answer: Follow-up care may be necessary, especially if stents or other treatments were performed during the procedure. Your doctor will provide guidance on any additional steps to ensure your recovery and health.

advancedprocedures.title: Bariatric Endoscopy- ESG (Endoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy)
advancedprocedures.description: A minimally invasive bariatric procedure for weight loss.

sections.heading: What is Endoscopic Sleeve Gastroplasty (ESG)?
content: Endoscopic Sleeve Gastroplasty (ESG) is a groundbreaking, minimally invasive weight loss procedure that helps patients achieve significant and sustainable weight loss without the need for traditional surgery. Utilizing advanced endoscopic technology, ESG involves no incisions, and patients can typically return to normal activities within a short time.

At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we offer ESG as part of our comprehensive bariatric endoscopy services, providing a modern, effective alternative for those looking to lose weight and improve their health without the complexities of surgery.

sections.heading: How ESG Works
sections.content:
ESG is performed through an endoscope – a flexible tube with a camera attached – inserted through the mouth, meaning there are no incisions required. The procedure works by using sutures to reduce the size of the stomach, creating a sleeve-like structure. This sleeve restricts the amount of food that can be consumed, helping patients feel full with smaller meals and promoting weight loss over time.

The procedure typically takes about 60-90 minutes, and patients are usually able to return home the same day. It’s an excellent option for those who are looking for an alternative to traditional weight-loss surgeries like gastric bypass or sleeve gastrectomy.

steps.title: Minimally Invasive
steps.description: ESG is performed without the need for any cuts or incisions, significantly reducing recovery time and risk compared to traditional surgery.

steps.title: No Hospital Stay
steps.description: Most patients can go home the same day after the procedure, making it a convenient and outpatient procedure.

steps.title: Sustainable Weight Loss
steps.description: ESG helps reduce the stomach’s capacity, allowing for more controlled food intake, which leads to gradual and sustainable weight loss over time.

steps.title: Quick Recovery
steps.description: Patients can typically return to their normal activities within a few days, as the recovery is much faster compared to invasive surgeries.

steps.title: Improved Health Outcomes
steps.description: Along with weight loss, ESG can lead to improvements in conditions associated with obesity, such as type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, and sleep apnea.

steps.title: Obesity
steps.description: For patients with a BMI (Body Mass Index) of 30 or higher who have struggled to lose weight through traditional methods such as diet and exercise.

steps.title: Type 2 Diabetes
steps.description: Weight loss from ESG can help improve insulin sensitivity and may even lead to a reduction in the need for diabetes medications.

steps.title: Hypertension
steps.description: ESG has been shown to help lower blood pressure by promoting weight loss.

steps.title: Sleep Apnea
steps.description: As excess weight is a common cause of sleep apnea, reducing weight through ESG can improve sleep quality and breathing.

sections.heading: The ESG Procedure: What to Expect

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Before the procedure, you will undergo an initial consultation and assessment, including a review of your medical history, current medications, and a physical exam. Your doctor will explain the procedure in detail and answer any questions you may have.

steps.title: Sedation
steps.description: The ESG procedure is performed under general anesthesia or conscious sedation, ensuring that you remain comfortable and relaxed during the process.

steps.title: Endoscope Insertion
steps.description: An endoscope is inserted through the mouth and into the stomach. The procedure involves no incisions or stitches on the skin.

steps.title: Stomach Suturing
steps.description: Once the endoscope is in place, your doctor will use specialized suturing techniques to reduce the size of your stomach, creating a sleeve-like structure that will limit food intake.

steps.title: Recovery
steps.description: ESG typically takes about 1-2 hours. You will be monitored as you wake up from sedation. Most patients can go home the same day, though some may require a short overnight stay for observation.

steps.title: Recovery
steps.description: Most patients can return to normal activities within 3-5 days, though some mild discomfort, such as bloating, nausea, or abdominal pain, is common in the first few days after the procedure. These symptoms typically resolve within a week.

steps.title: Diet
steps.description: Following the procedure, you will be put on a liquid diet for the first few weeks, gradually transitioning to soft foods and then solid foods over time. It’s important to follow the dietary guidelines provided by your doctor for optimal results.

steps.title: Follow-up Care
steps.description: Regular follow-up visits will be scheduled to monitor your progress, track your weight loss, and ensure that you are healing properly. Our team will provide continuous support and guidance to help you maintain a healthy lifestyle after your procedure.

sections.heading: Why Choose ESG at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE

steps.title: Expert Bariatric Team
steps.description: Our team of skilled gastroenterologists and bariatric specialists have extensive experience in performing ESG, ensuring you receive the highest level of care.

steps.title: State-of-the-Art Technology
steps.description: We utilize the latest endoscopic techniques and equipment to perform ESG with precision and care, ensuring the best possible outcomes for our patients.

steps.title: Patient-Centered Care
steps.description: At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we focus on providing compassionate, personalized care. From consultation to post-procedure support, we are here for you every step of the way.

steps.title: Comprehensive Weight Loss Support
steps.description: ESG is part of a complete weight loss program that includes dietary support, lifestyle changes, and ongoing monitoring to ensure your success in reaching your weight loss goals.

faq.question: How much weight can I expect to lose with ESG?
faq.answer: Patients can typically expect to lose 30-50% of their excess weight within the first 12-18 months after the procedure. Results vary depending on factors such as adherence to post-procedure guidelines and lifestyle changes.

faq.question: Is ESG a permanent solution for weight loss?
faq.answer: While ESG significantly reduces the stomach’s capacity and helps control food intake, long-term weight loss success depends on maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet and regular physical activity.

faq.question: Are there any risks involved in ESG?
faq.answer: As with any medical procedure, there are risks involved, including bleeding, infection, and complications related to sedation. However, ESG is considered a safe procedure with a low risk of complications, especially when performed by experienced specialists.

faq.question: How long will the results last?
faq.answer: The weight loss from ESG can be sustained with lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and regular exercise. However, as with any weight loss treatment, maintaining weight loss requires ongoing commitment.

faq.question: Am I a candidate for ESG?
faq.answer: ESG is recommended for patients with a BMI of 30 or higher who have not had success with traditional weight loss methods. Your doctor will assess your overall health and determine whether ESG is the right choice for you.
