introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Fecal incontinence is the inability to control bowel movements, leading to unintentional leakage. This condition can severely affect emotional and physical well-being but is treatable.

list.heading: Urgency to defecate
list.description: A sudden and strong need to have a bowel movement.

list.description: Reduced muscle strength compromises control over bowel movements.

overview.heading: Overview
content: The liver is one of the most vital organs, performing over 500 essential functions, including detoxification, protein synthesis, and aiding digestion. When liver function declines due to chronic disease, infections, or other conditions, specialized care is crucial. The Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, Hyderabad, is dedicated to diagnosing, managing, and treating all liver-related diseases, offering state-of-the-art liver transplant services when necessary.

Our team of highly experienced hepatologists, liver transplant surgeons, and support staff ensures a multidisciplinary approach to care, backed by cutting-edge technology. From preventive care to advanced treatments, we are a trusted destination for liver health in Hyderabad and Secunderabad.

faq.heading: FAQs for the Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic

questions.question: Who qualifies for a liver transplant?
questions.answer: Patients with end-stage liver disease or liver cancer who meet medical and transplant eligibility criteria.

questions.question: What is the recovery period for a liver transplant?
questions.answer: Most patients recover within 3-6 months, with follow-up care.

questions.question: Can liver disease be reversed?
questions.answer: Early-stage liver conditions can often be reversed with lifestyle changes and medical care. Advanced stages like cirrhosis require long-term management or transplantation.

questions.question: What is TACE?
questions.answer: Transarterial Chemoembolization is a minimally invasive procedure used to treat liver cancer by blocking blood flow to the tumor and delivering chemotherapy directly.

questions.question: Why is KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE preferred for liver care in Hyderabad?
questions.answer: With expert hepatologists, cutting-edge technology, and high success rates in transplants, KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE is a trusted name for liver care in India.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Chronic Liver Disease (CLD) refers to the gradual and progressive damage to the liver over an extended period, leading to impaired liver function. The most severe form of CLD is cirrhosis, where scar tissue replaces healthy liver tissue, impacting the liver's ability to regenerate and perform essential functions like detoxification and digestion. In India, CLD is one of the leading causes of morbidity, often linked to hepatitis infections, alcohol consumption, and metabolic conditions. The Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic at KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, Hyderabad, specializes in early diagnosis, treatment, and management of CLD, ensuring patients receive personalized care.

list.description: Ongoing tiredness and lack of energy.

list.heading: Jaundice
list.description: Yellowing of skin and eyes due to elevated bilirubin levels.

list.description: Fluid retention causing visible swelling.

list.heading: Easy bruising or bleeding
list.description: Reduced ability to clot blood due to liver dysfunction.

list.heading: Loss of appetite and unintentional weight loss
list.description: Decreased desire to eat, resulting in weight loss.

list.heading: Nausea, vomiting, and abdominal discomfort
list.description: Symptoms due to liver inflammation or damage.

list.heading: Confusion or difficulty concentrating (hepatic encephalopathy)
list.description: Mental changes caused by the liver's inability to remove toxins from the blood.

list.description: Hepatitis B and C are major causes of CLD in India.

list.description: Excessive drinking over time leads to alcoholic liver disease.

list.description: Linked to obesity, diabetes, and metabolic syndrome.

list.description: The immune system mistakenly attacks liver cells.

list.description: Conditions like Wilson’s disease and hemochromatosis.

list.description: Certain medications can damage liver cells over time.

list.heading: Family history of liver disease
list.description: Genetic predisposition to liver conditions.

list.heading: Long-term alcohol consumption
list.description: Chronic alcohol use increases liver disease risk.

list.heading: Obesity or diabetes
list.description: Metabolic conditions that strain liver health.

list.heading: Exposure to hepatitis viruses
list.description: Infection with Hepatitis B or C virus.

list.description: Some substances may harm the liver over time.

list.description: Factors like an unhealthy diet and lack of exercise.

list.heading: Portal Hypertension
list.description: Increased pressure in the portal vein, leading to varices.

list.description: Chronic inflammation can lead to hepatocellular carcinoma.

list.heading: Liver Failure
list.description: The liver loses its ability to function, necessitating transplantation.

list.description: Liver function tests (LFTs) to measure enzyme levels and protein production.

list.description: Ultrasound, CT scans, and MRI for detailed liver structure analysis.

list.heading: Liver Biopsy
list.description: A small sample of liver tissue is examined for scarring and inflammation.

list.heading: Lifestyle Modifications
list.description: A healthy diet, alcohol cessation, and weight management.

list.heading: Medications
list.description: Antiviral drugs for hepatitis, immunosuppressants for autoimmune hepatitis, and other supportive therapies.

list.heading: Endoscopic Procedures
list.description: To manage varices and portal hypertension.

list.heading: Liver Transplant
list.description: For advanced cases where the liver can no longer function effectively.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Hepatitis refers to inflammation of the liver, often caused by viral infections. In India, Hepatitis B and C are among the leading causes of chronic liver disease, while Hepatitis A and E are more commonly associated with waterborne infections. Hepatitis can range from mild, self-limiting illnesses to chronic conditions that cause severe liver damage and cirrhosis. At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we offer a robust hepatitis care program, including early diagnosis, antiviral treatments, vaccination services, and preventive care.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) refers to the accumulation of excess fat in the liver of individuals who consume little to no alcohol. NAFLD is rapidly becoming a major health concern in India due to increasing obesity, diabetes, and sedentary lifestyles. It can progress from simple fatty liver to more severe forms, such as Non-Alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH), fibrosis, cirrhosis, or liver cancer. At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE’s Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic in Hyderabad, we provide cutting-edge diagnosis, personalized treatment plans, and comprehensive care for NAFLD.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Liver cancer, particularly Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC), is one of the most common and fatal cancers in India. It often develops in patients with chronic liver diseases like hepatitis B/C, cirrhosis, or NAFLD. Early detection is crucial for successful treatment, as liver cancer tends to progress rapidly. At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE’s Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic, our specialists employ cutting-edge technologies and multidisciplinary treatments to diagnose and manage liver cancer effectively.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Portal Hypertension is a condition where there is an abnormally high blood pressure in the portal vein, which carries blood from the digestive organs to the liver. This condition is commonly seen in patients with cirrhosis or other chronic liver diseases. It can lead to severe complications, including variceal bleeding and ascites. At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE’s Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic in Hyderabad, we specialize in diagnosing and managing portal hypertension with a multidisciplinary approach and advanced interventions.

list.heading: Abdominal swelling due to fluid accumulation (ascites)
list.description: Accumulation of fluid in the abdomen, causing noticeable swelling.

list.heading: Enlarged spleen (splenomegaly)
list.description: The spleen enlarges due to increased pressure in the portal vein.

list.heading: Blood in stools or vomiting blood (variceal bleeding)
list.description: Bleeding from enlarged veins in the esophagus or stomach.

list.heading: Low platelet count
list.description: Decreased platelet count due to spleen enlargement and liver dysfunction.

list.heading: Abdominal pain or discomfort
list.description: Pain or discomfort in the abdomen due to portal hypertension.

list.heading: Fatigue and confusion (hepatic encephalopathy)
list.description: Mental confusion and tiredness due to liver dysfunction.

list.heading: Cirrhosis
list.description: The most common cause of portal hypertension due to liver scarring.

list.heading: Thrombosis
list.description: Blood clots in the portal or hepatic veins, restricting blood flow.

list.heading: Liver Infections
list.description: Chronic infections like Hepatitis B, C, or schistosomiasis can lead to portal hypertension.

list.heading: Fatty Liver Disease
list.description: Advanced NAFLD or NASH can cause portal hypertension.

list.description: Structural issues with the portal vein from birth can lead to increased pressure.

list.heading: Chronic liver disease and cirrhosis
list.description: Chronic liver damage from various causes, especially cirrhosis.

list.description: Excessive alcohol intake leads to liver scarring and portal hypertension.

list.description: Chronic viral infections can contribute to liver damage and portal hypertension.

list.heading: Obesity and fatty liver disease
list.description: Obesity and fatty liver disease (NAFLD) are risk factors for developing portal hypertension.

list.heading: Genetic liver conditions
list.description: Inherited liver disorders may contribute to increased portal pressure.

list.heading: Variceal Bleeding
list.description: Rupture of enlarged veins in the stomach or esophagus, leading to bleeding.

list.heading: Ascites
list.description: Fluid buildup in the abdomen, causing severe swelling.

list.description: A condition where liver dysfunction leads to mental confusion and altered mental state.

list.heading: Splenomegaly
list.description: Enlarged spleen that can lead to a reduction in blood counts.

list.heading: Imaging Tests
list.description: Ultrasound, Doppler studies, and CT/MRI scans to assess blood flow in the portal vein.

list.heading: Endoscopy
list.description: Used to detect varices (swollen veins) in the esophagus or stomach.

list.heading: Liver Biopsy
list.description: Helps to identify the underlying liver disease causing portal hypertension.

list.heading: Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient (HVPG)
list.description: Measures the pressure within the portal vein to confirm the diagnosis of portal hypertension.

list.heading: Medications
list.description: Beta-blockers are used to reduce portal pressure and prevent bleeding.

list.heading: Endoscopic Therapy
list.description: Band ligation or sclerotherapy to manage variceal bleeding.

list.heading: TIPS Procedure (Transjugular Intrahepatic Portosystemic Shunt)
list.description: A minimally invasive procedure to reduce portal vein pressure.

list.heading: Paracentesis
list.description: Draining fluid buildup in ascites to reduce abdominal swelling.

list.heading: Liver Transplant
list.description: For severe cases of portal hypertension with advanced liver disease.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Alcoholic Liver Disease (ALD) occurs due to excessive alcohol consumption, leading to liver inflammation, fatty liver, cirrhosis, or even liver cancer. ALD is a significant health issue in India, especially among individuals with prolonged alcohol abuse. At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE’s Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic, we offer comprehensive evaluation, counseling, and treatment for ALD, focusing on both liver health and alcohol rehabilitation.

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Acute Liver Failure (ALF) is a life-threatening condition where the liver suddenly loses its ability to function, often within days or weeks. Unlike chronic liver disease, ALF occurs rapidly in people without pre-existing liver conditions. It requires urgent medical care, and in many cases, a liver transplant becomes necessary to save the patient’s life. At KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE, we provide expert, timely intervention with state-of-the-art facilities for diagnosing and managing ALF, ensuring the best possible outcomes for our patients.

subpages.title: Biliary Atresia and Other Pediatric Liver Conditions

introduction.heading: Overview
introduction.description: Biliary Atresia is a rare pediatric liver disease where the bile ducts are either absent or blocked, leading to bile buildup and liver damage. It is the most common reason for liver transplantation in children. Along with biliary atresia, KIMS Advanced Gastroenterology & Endoscopy - KAGE also specializes in managing other pediatric liver conditions like neonatal hepatitis, metabolic liver disorders, and liver tumors. Our team at the Advanced Liver Care and Transplant Clinic in Hyderabad provides specialized care for children with liver conditions, focusing on early diagnosis and customized treatment plans.

overview.heading: Overview
content: The Women GI Clinic at KAGE, Hyderabad is dedicated exclusively to the unique gastrointestinal health needs of women. Recognizing that hormonal fluctuations, reproductive factors, and lifestyle differences can influence digestive health, our specialized clinic provides comprehensive care tailored for women.

Our expert team of gastroenterologists, nutritionists, and women’s health specialists work together to address issues ranging from common digestive discomforts to complex disorders that uniquely affect women.

why_choose.heading: Why Choose KAGE Women GI Clinic?
why_choose.description: At KAGE, Hyderabad, we combine decades of expertise with cutting-edge technology to deliver personalized gastrointestinal care for women. Our clinic is designed to address the specific needs of women at every stage of life, ensuring improved quality of life and enhanced digestive health.

faq.question: What makes women’s GI disorders different from those in men?
faq.answer: Women often experience GI disorders differently due to hormonal fluctuations, reproductive factors, and metabolic differences. Our clinic tailors diagnosis and treatment to these unique needs.

faq.question: Are the diagnostic procedures different for women?
faq.answer: While the core diagnostic tools are similar, our approach considers factors such as pregnancy, menstrual cycles, and menopause to provide more accurate evaluations.

faq.question: Can you help manage GI symptoms during pregnancy?
faq.answer: Absolutely. We provide specialized care for pregnant women, ensuring both maternal and fetal well-being through tailored treatment and lifestyle advice.

overview.heading: Overview
content: The Alcohol Clinic at KAGE, Hyderabad offers specialized care for patients with alcohol-related gastrointestinal disorders and liver diseases.

Recognizing that alcohol consumption can lead to a spectrum of digestive health issues—from acute gastritis to advanced cirrhosis and alcohol-induced pancreatitis—we provide a comprehensive program that emphasizes early intervention, rehabilitation, and long-term health management.

why_choose.heading: Why Choose KAGE Alcohol Clinic?
why_choose.description: At KAGE, Hyderabad, our Alcohol Clinic is at the forefront of treating alcohol-related gastrointestinal and liver disorders. With a multidisciplinary team, innovative treatment protocols, and a compassionate, patient-centered approach, we help patients reclaim their health and improve their quality of life through integrated care and lasting support.

faq.question: How do you diagnose alcohol-related GI disorders?
faq.answer: We use a combination of blood tests, imaging (ultrasound, FibroScan), endoscopy, and comprehensive patient history to diagnose conditions related to alcohol use.

faq.question: Can treatment reverse liver damage caused by alcohol?
faq.answer: Early-stage liver damage, such as fatty liver, can often be reversed with proper treatment and abstinence. Advanced damage like cirrhosis requires ongoing management and, in severe cases, may need liver transplantation.

faq.question: What support do you offer for alcohol rehabilitation?
faq.answer: We offer behavioral counseling, support groups, nutritional therapy, and continuous follow-up care to help patients maintain sobriety and manage health complications.

listItems: Fasting for at least 6-8 hours before the procedure.
Bowel cleansing may be required in some cases.
Inform the doctor about any medications being taken.

subTopics.description: Potential risks associated with endoscopy.
listItems: Minimal bleeding at the biopsy site.
Rare chance of perforation in the digestive tract.

course_description.title: About Us
description: KIMS hospitals is a renowned healthcare institution known for its excellence in patient care and medical education. With state-of-the-art facilities, cutting-edge technology, and a team of highly skilled medical professionals, KIMS hospitals is committed to providing the best healthcare services.

The department of gastroenterology was established in 2004 at the beginning of the healthcare institution with an aim to create awareness and provide super-specialty patient care. Various senior faculty like Dr. Nagarjuna Kumar, Dr. Sethu Babu, and Dr. Ajith Kumar were instrumental in steering this place towards professional and academic excellence.

Apart from routine inpatient and outpatient services, the department aims at academic training to DrNB registrars, endoscopy training fellows, endoscopy technicians, and specialist nurses. We have also recently established specialty clinics for IBD, Pancreas, and Corrosive patients.

The department can proudly vouch for excellence in advanced endoscopy work. Under the auspices of Dr. Sreekanth Appasani, we have been recognized as a National Skill Development Centre by ERBE for Third Space Endoscopy & Advanced Gastroenterology.
The department has a total of 13 proficient consultant gastroenterologists, the largest in the state among corporate hospitals.

faculty.designation: Lead Consultant, Motility & Functional Bowel Diseases

course_description.title: Technician Training Programme at KIMS Secunderabad
description: The department offers a 2-year training course for technical assistance skills in endoscopy. This programme is designed to offer comprehensive training and education in the field of both basic and interventional endoscopy, equipping technicians with the knowledge and skills necessary to become competent assistants in the field under the guidance of renowned gastroenterologists. It’s a paid training course and the participant will be engaged in clinical work along with daily training. A total of 2 students will be taken for this course on a yearly basis.

course_description.title: Aims
description: The aim is to impart high-quality training in endoscopy to technicians at various levels, including basic procedures (endoscopy, colonoscopy), therapeutics (ERCP, Dilatation, Polypectomy, EUS), and advanced therapeutics (SpyGlass, Lithotripsy, Enteroscopy, EMR, ESD, POEM). The goal is to train technicians who are limited in numbers and availability to make the endoscopy work of gastroenterologists easier, ensuring quality patient care. We will try to accommodate them in our hospital chain after completion, where a need is present if agreeable to them.

course_description.title: Eligibility Requirements
description: Candidates are selected through an interview process after reviewing the candidates’ applications submitted through the hospital portal. Candidates are expected to have completed and passed their 12th exams before joining this course. Nursing background and science/technical background graduates will be given preference over others.

course_description.title: Course Fee Structure
description: The course fee is 1 lakh rupees, Rs. 50,000 per annum. Payments are to be done annually at the beginning of each year. Part payments are not accepted. All payments are to be done to the KIMS Hospitals accounts. Payment through cheque, DD, and online transfers are accepted. Cash payments are not accepted.

listItems.title: Comprehensive Curriculum
listItems.description: Our technician training programme covers all aspects of endoscopy, including basics to advanced procedures. They will also develop experience in endoscope maintenance, endoscopy machinery maintenance, and endoscopy recording and reporting software management.

listItems.title: Clinical Experience
listItems.description: Technicians will have exposure to a wide range of endoscopy cases, both common and complex, allowing them to develop expertise in the assistance of various procedures.

listItems.title: State-of-the-Art Facilities
listItems.description: KIMS Hospitals are equipped with advanced medical technology and facilities, including endoscopy suites, diagnostic imaging, and dedicated research laboratories.

listItems.title: Faculty Expertise
listItems.description: Our faculty comprises experienced gastroenterologists who are passionate about teaching and mentoring the technicians as next-generation gastroenterology assistant professionals.

course_description.title: course structure
topics: Initial 6 months of the course will be lectures and observation in the endoscopy unit.
Next six months will be learning to assist the procedures from the qualified technicians.
At the end of One year, there will be a theory examination to assess their proficiency.
After clearing the theory, there will be one year of internship with stipend.
At the end of internship, there will be a practical examination to assess performance and technical competency.
Trainee needs to maintain a log-book which will be audited quarterly.
Degree will be awarded as Endoscopy Technician.

course_description.title: Course Curriculum in detail
topics: Trainee technician will be attached to the endoscopy department, will observe, assist procedures routine and therapeutic.
Didactic lectures will be taken to the technicians on a fortnightly basis with emphasis on basics of endoscopic anatomy, physiology, pathology and endoscopy, electrocautery, accessories.

course_description.title: procedures
topics: Diagnostic endoscopy, sigmoidoscopy, colonoscopy
Therapeutic procedures: Dilatation, Banding, Sclerotherapy, Polypectomy, Clip application, Hemostasis, Peg placement, Argon plasma Coagulation
ERCP – Biliary and Pancreatic: Cannulation, Sphincterotomy, Dilatation, Stenting, stone extraction
Spy-Glass Cholangioscopy
Manometry – Technique, maintenance and reporting
Endoscopic Ultrasound: Diagnostic and therapeutics such as FNAC, Celiac Plexus Block-Neurolysis, cystogastrostomy
Third space endoscopy assistance

course_description.title: hospital Duties
topics: Clinical work will be endorsed daily in the endoscopy department on a rotational basis, based on their shift pattern and need.
Trainee needs to attend and take up emergency procedure on calls along with on-call technician.
Routine work timings: 2 shifts, 8 am - 4 pm & 10 am - 6 pm

course_description.title: accommodation food transport
topics: Trainee will be provided access to the hospital canteen and food cards will be provided (payment for same at their own expenses).
Trainees must make their own arrangements for stay and transport.

course_description.title: EUS Short Term Fellowship Programme at KIMS Hospitals, Secunderabad (Department of Gastroenterology)
description: We personally feel EUS is no more a fancy investigation, it has become the common helping hand in the diagnostic armamentarium of gastroenterology complementing clinical and radiological assessments.

The department offers various training courses of variable time duration for sharpening your endoscopic ultrasound skills. These programs are designed to offer comprehensive training and education in the field of interventional endoscopy equipping fellows with the knowledge and skills necessary to become competent clinicians in the field along with research opportunities under the guidance of renowned gastroenterologists.

This is a two weeks (10-15 days) training programme which covers basic to therapeutic EUS. It’s a paid training course and the participant will be allowed hands-on training on diagnostic and a few types of therapeutic EUS under supervision from expert faculty. 1-2 candidates will be taken for this course, and it will be conducted on a monthly basis.

course_description.title: Aims
description: The aim is to impact high quality training in Endoscopic Ultrasound Basics and Therapeutics like FNAC, FN Biopsy, Celiac Plexus Block
The goal is to train the endoscopists who are starting their career and disseminate the knowledge for quality patient care

course_description.title: Eligibility Requirements
description: Candidates are selected through an interview process after reviewing the candidates applications submitted through the hospital portal.
Candidates are expected to have completed and passed their specialty exams (DM or DrNB) before joining these courses.

course_description.title: Course Fee Structure
description: The Course Fee is 1.5 lakh Rupees.
All payments are to be done to the KIMS Hospitals account
Payment through cheque, DD and online transfers are accepted.
Cash payments are not accepted. All payments are to be made before joining the course, part payments are not accepted.

listItems.description: Our fellowship programme covers all aspects of training in Endoscopic Ultrasound from basics to therapeutics.

listItems.description: Trainees will have exposure to a wide range of clinical cases. Both common and complex, allowing them to develop proficiency in performing the endoscopic ultrasound.
